snippet: The U.M.P., which backed Nicolas Sarkozy’s failed re-election bid in 2012, is said to be in financial crisis in part over expenses from that effort.
abstract: France's main conservative opposition party discloses that it is more than $100 million in debt, part of intensifying crisis from Nicolas Sarkozy's failed re-election campaign in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The U.M.P., which backed Nicolas Sarkozy’s failed re-election bid in 2012, is said to be in financial crisis in part over expenses from that effort.

headline.main: Deep in Debt, Sarkozy’s Party Might Have to Sit Out Next Election
